intro: Cyrtandra pickeringii var. crassifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed cyrtandra, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that are often glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which attract pollinators such as bees and moths. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in parts of Indonesia and Malaysia. This species thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
